techsList.title: ReactJS
techsList.description: React is a declarative, component-based JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

techsList.title: AngularJS
techsList.description: AngularJS (commonly reffered to as AngularJS 1.X) is a JavaScript framework for building SPAs with an MVC architecture.

techsList.title: VueJS
techsList.description: Vue.js (pronounced /vjuː/, like view) is an open-source JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.

techsList.title: Elm
techsList.description: Elm is a domain-specific programming language for declaratively creating web browser-based graphical user interfaces.

techsList.title: Polymer
techsList.description: Polymer is an open-source JavaScript library for building web applications using Web Components.

techsList.title: Ruby on Rails
techsList.description: Ruby on Rails, or Rails, is a server-side web application framework written in Ruby. Rails is an MVC framework, providing default structures for a database, a web service, and web pages.

techsList.title: NodeJS
techsList.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. Uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model taht makes it lightweight and efficient.

techsList.title: ASP.NET Core
techsList.description: ASP.NET Core is the next generation of ASP.NET. It is a modular framework that runs on both the full .NET Framework, on Windows, and the cross-platform .NET Core.

techsList.title: Django
techsList.description: Django (/ˈdʒæŋɡoʊ/ JANG-goh)[5] is a free and open-source web framework, written in Python, which follows the model-view-template (MVT) architectural pattern.
